intro: Anemone polyanthes, commonly known as the garden anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has a short, stout rhizome and produces numerous hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden borders. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
